meanings.definition: Darker in skin color than another person.
meanings.sent1: The man with the swarthier skin stood out in the crowd.
meanings.sent2: She noticed that her friend's skin was swarthier than hers.
meanings.sent3: At the beach, he joked that he would get swarthier than a chocolate bar.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered, casting a swarthier shadow over the land.
meanings.sent5: The cave was so dark that it seemed to absorb all light, making everything inside appear swarthier.

meanings.definition: Having a dark or dusky complexion.
meanings.sent1: The actress had a swarthier complexion after spending hours under the sun.
meanings.sent2: In the painting, the artist captured the swarthier features of the model's face.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur looked swarthier under the dim streetlight, making it seem mysterious.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the landscape took on a swarthier hue, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The old book had a swarthier cover compared to the new one, hinting at its age.
